  -----Original Message-----
  From:=

  Rich - 

  Interesting to see this tsuba. My Akas=
aka of this design signed
  Tadashige (to my relief) passed shinsa in Chica=
go. Of course I have it
  here in front of me now to compare the work with =
your tsuba. While the
  design is the same, the work on mine is more delica=
te (?)--more
  piercing--and seems to "flow" more, if you know what I mean.=
 The
  horse's hoofs on your tsuba are more "squared" and "bold" than the m=
ore
  naturally shaped hoofs on my tsuba. I just saw a similar tsuba
  (pic=
ture) just the other day that showed these rather boldly made hoofs
  and i=
t was called something other than Akasaka, but for the life of me
  I don't=
 recall where I saw this. Thought it was in the new Mosle'
  catalogue, but=
 if so, I'm not finding it now. My tsuba came out of a
  large collection o=
f tsuba sold in Santiago, Chile in 2003. That
  collection also had another=
 similar "horse" tsuba that had these large
  hoofs like your new tsuba, bu=
t I didn't buy that one. Most of these
  730-plus tsuba were bought up by M=
ichael Zomber, so perhaps your's
  could be the one I saw. I'll check my re=
cords. 

  Ron
  STL
